## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining and Processing Facility at Position (41.0, -82.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (41.0, -82.0)
- Stone Furnace at position (43.0, -82.0)
- Iron Chest at position (41.5, -80.5)
- Burner Inserters at positions (40.5, -80.5), (42.5, -80.5), and (43.5, -80.5)
- Wooden Chest at position (41.5, -79.5)
- Additional Burner Inserters at positions (41.5, -78.5) and (41.5, -77.5)

### Iron Ore Mining and Processing Facility at Position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (-15.0, -50.0)
- Stone Furnaces at positions (-13.0, -48.0), (-11.0, -48.0), and (-9.0, -48.0)
- Wooden Chests at positions (-14.5, -48.5), (-12.5, -49.5), and (-9.5, -49.5)
- Iron Chest at position (-14.5, -47.5)
- Burner Inserters at positions (-15.5, -48.5), (-14.5, -46.5), and (-14.5, -45.5)

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors When Extracting or Transferring Items
- Ensure that the target entity from which you want to extract or to which you want to transfer items is not full or blocked. Check the inventory status of chests and furnaces before attempting to extract or transfer items.

### Errors Due to Undefined Variables
- Make sure all variables are properly defined before use. For example, ensure `new_coal_storage` is defined and initialized before attempting to use it in operations. Double-check for typos or similar variable names that might cause confusion.

### Inserter Waiting for Source Items
- Check that the source entities for inserters have the necessary items available. Ensure that the production chain is not blocked and that resources are being fed into the system correctly.

### Errors When Using Extracting but Being Too Far
- Make sure to move to the target entity where you want to extract from before extracting items.
